cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 625 mi (1005 km) SE of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, then bending northwest toward the Carolinas coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina/South Carolina border vicinity (near Wilmington–Myrtle Beach area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast from northern Florida through North Carolina, including all of South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (33% onset, 50% cumulative) of tropical-storm force winds; up to low–moderate chance (22% cumulative) of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out (11% cumulative).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Major hurricane approaching from the east could drive 3–6 ft or locally higher surge along the South Carolina coast, including Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Very heavy rain bands possible with totals exceeding 4–8 inches in the Charleston area if the core skirts the coast or moves inland just north of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and possible coastal flooding in advance of the storm.
